get.description: Get metadata for a team for a specific namespace.

200.description: OK - Returns the metadata of a Team object for a specific namespace.

requestBody.description: Supply a JSON representation of your metadata.

1.summary: Set a specific CRM opportunity ID as a single property

2.summary: Set a specific CRM opportunity ID as a single property using JSON dotted notation

3.summary: Set multiple CRM opportunity and account properties using JSON dotted notation

200.description: OK - Returns the metadata of a Team object for a specific namespace.

patch.description: Update a team metadata for a specific namespace. N.B Using the PATCH method will merge supplied body with pre-existing metadata.

requestBody.description: Supply a JSON representation of your metadata.

1.summary: Add a specific CRM opportunity ID to existing metadata as a single property

2.summary: Add a specific CRM opportunity ID to existing metadata as a single property using JSON dotted notation

3.summary: Add a multiple CRM opportunity and account properties to existing metadata using JSON dotted notation

200.description: OK - Returns the metadata of a Team object for a specific namespace.

post.description: Query metadata for a specific namespace. TIER 2️⃣ | ROLES - AUTHORIZED_APP, INTEGRATION_MANAGER, GOVERNANCE_MANAGER, TEAMS_SERVICE_ADMIN, GLOBAL_ADMIN.

requestBody.description: Supply a JSON representation of your query.

1.summary: Search for an artefact associated with a specific CRM opportunity as a single property

2.summary: Search for an artefact associated with a specific CRM opportunity using JSON dotted notation

3.summary: Search for an artefact associated with multiple CRM objects using JSON dotted notation

200.description: OK - Returns a list of artefacts from a query on their metadata from a specific namespace.

post.description: Archive a team. TIER 1️⃣ | ROLES - AUTHENTICATED_USER.

requestBody.description: In the request, you may optionally include the shouldSetSpoSiteReadOnlyForMembers parameter in a JSON body. This optional parameter defines whether to set permissions for team members to read-only on the SharePoint Online site associated with the team. Setting it to false or omitting the body altogether will result in this step being skipped.

202.description: Accepted - The response will also contain a Location header, which contains the location of the teamsAsyncOperation that was created to handle archiving of the team. Check the status of the archiving operation by making a GET request to this location.

post.description: Unarchive a team. TIER 1️⃣ | ROLES - AUTHENTICATED_USER.

202.description: Accepted - The response will also contain a Location header, which contains the location of the teamsAsyncOperation that was created to handle archiving of the team. Check the status of the archiving operation by making a GET request to this location.

get.description: Get team members.

200.description: OK - Returns a collection of team members object.

post.description: Add a team member. TIER 2️⃣ | ROLES - AUTHENTICATED_USER.

201.description: Accepted - The response will also contain a Location header, which contains the location of the teamsAsyncOperation that was created to handle archiving of the team. Check the status of the archiving operation by making a GET request to this location.

CatalogTemplates.title: Catalog Templates
CatalogTemplates.description: A collection of templates from your corporate catalog. See [https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/CatalogTemplate](https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/CatalogTemplate) for more information.

@odata.count.description: Number of templates in the collection

CatalogTemplate.title: Catalog Template
CatalogTemplate.description: A template from your corporate catalog. See [https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/CatalogTemplate](https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/CatalogTemplate) for more information.

templateConfiguration.description: Information about the template and its related policies

enabled.description: Defines if the template is enabled or not, and therefore available for end-users or not.

system.description: Defines if the template should be considered as 'system', and therefore could not be deleted, exported...

singleton.description: Defines if the template should restrict the number of associated teams created from itself to one.

domId.description: Unique identifier that could be used safely client-side to identify an HTML tag.

requireApproval.description: Defines if the template requires an approval or not.

enabled.description: Defines if the template should be restricted to specific audiences or not.

rulesWithTags.description: Defines the audience targeting rules (With the tags HTML representation).

rules.description: Defines the audience targeting rules (Without the tags HTML representation).

clonedTeam.description: Properties of the source team that should be cloned.

includeApps.description: Defines if apps should be cloned from the source team.

includeTabs.description: Defines if tabs should be cloned from the source team.

includeSettings.description: Defines if the team settings should be cloned from the source team.

includeChannels.description: Defines if channels should be cloned from the source team.

includeMembers.description: Defines if membership (members and owners) should be cloned from the source team.

newTeam.description: Properties of the new team that will be created by the provisioning job.

namingConventionWithTags.description: Defines the naming convention for the new team name (With the tags HTML representation).

emailConventionWithTags.description: Defines the naming convention for the email associated with the underlying group of the new team name (With the tags HTML representation).

descriptionConventionWithTags.description: Defines the naming convention for the new team description (With the tags HTML representation).

welcomeMessageConventionWithTags.description: Defines the naming convention for the new team welcome message (With the tags HTML representation).

namingConvention.description: Defines the naming convention for the new team name (Without the tags HTML representation).

emailConvention.description: Defines the naming convention for the email associated with the underlying group of the new team name (Without the tags HTML representation).

descriptionConvention.description: Defines the naming convention for the new team description (Without the tags HTML representation).

welcomeMessageConvention.description: Defines the naming convention for the new team welcome message (Without the tags HTML representation).

defaultName.description: Defines the default team name presented to end-users in the new team provisioning form.

defaultDescription.description: Defines the default team description presented to end-users in the new team provisioning form.

defaultWelcomeMessage.description: Defines the default team welcome message presented to end-users in the new team provisioning form.

teamPrivacy.description: Defines the new team privacy level.

addRequesterAsTeamOwner.description: Defines if the requester of the new team should be invited as a team owner or just as a team member.

TeamProvisioningRequest.title: Team Provisioning Request
TeamProvisioningRequest.description: A request to provision a team based on a template from your corporate catalog. See [https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/ProvisioningRequest](https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/ProvisioningRequest) for more information.

template.description: Template to be applied to the provisioned team

team.description: Properties of the team to be created

membership.description: Requested members and owners of the team to be provisioned

MembersUserIdentifiers.title: Teams members
MembersUserIdentifiers.description: An array of UserIdentifier. See [https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/UserIdentifier](https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/UserIdentifier) for more information.

OwnersUserIdentifiers.title: Team owners
OwnersUserIdentifiers.description: An array of UserIdentifier. See [https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/UserIdentifier](https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/UserIdentifier) for more information.

MemberUserIdentifier.title: Team member
MemberUserIdentifier.description: Object representing a user. User identifier could be its ID, UPN or email. See See [https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/UserIdentifier](https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/UserIdentifier) for more information.

OwnerUserIdentifier.title: Team owner
OwnerUserIdentifier.description: Object representing a user. User identifier could be its ID, UPN or email. See See [https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/UserIdentifier](https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/UserIdentifier) for more information.

AppMetadata.title: App Metadata
AppMetadata.description: Metadata from the app client as a JSON object. See [https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/AppMetadata](https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/VirtualAppMetadata) for more information.

@odata.count.description: Number of events in the collection

HookSignatureRequest.title: Hook Signature Request
HookSignatureRequest.description: A HookSignatureRequest object comprised of the secret and payload.

HookSignature.title: Hook Signature
HookSignature.description: A Hook Signature generated from a secret and a payload.

PermanentMembership.title: Permanent membership settings
PermanentMembership.description: Owners and members of permanent membership settings.

PermanentMembers.title: Permanent Members
PermanentMembers.description: Members of a permanent membership team, as an array of PermanentMember. See [https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/PermanentMember](https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/PermanentMember) for more information.

PermanentMember.title: Permanent Member
PermanentMember.description: Object representing a permanent member. See See [https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/PermanentMember](https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/PermanentMember) for more information.

ApprovalTeamMembers.title: Approval Team Members
ApprovalTeamMembers.description: Members of an approval team, as an array of ApprovalTeamMember. See [https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/ApprovalTeamMember](https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/ApprovalTeamMember) for more information.

ApprovalTeamMember.title: Approval Team Member
ApprovalTeamMember.description: Object representing an approval team member. See See [https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/ApprovalTeamMember](https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/ApprovalTeamMember) for more information.

Job.title: Job
Job.description: A job that performs some tasks asynchronously. See [https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/Job](https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/Job) for more information.

id.description: The job ID, auto-generated at creation

data.description: The job data (for instance a `ProvisioningRequest` object)

JobLogs.title: Job Logs
JobLogs.description: A collection of JobLogsEntry. See [https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/JobLogs](https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/JobLogs) for more information.

JobLogsEntry.title: Job Logs Entry
JobLogsEntry.description: A job logs entry. See [https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/JobLogsEntry](https://docs.nbold.co/api/latest/reference/Models/JobLogsEntry) for more information.

innerError.description: JSON representation of the inner error (If available)

200.description: OK - Indicates that the request has succeeded.

201.description: Created - Indicates that the request has been fulfilled and has resulted in one or more new resources being created.

202.description: Accepted - Indicates that the request has been accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed.

400.description: Bad Request - Indicates that the server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing). See [Handling expected errors](https://docs.nbold.co/api/best-practices.html#handling-expected-errors) article for more information.

401.description: Unauthorized - Indicates that the request has not been applied because it lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource (e.g., missing or invalid access token or API key...). See [Handling expected errors](https://docs.nbold.co/api/best-practices.html#handling-expected-errors) article for more information.

402.description: Payment Required - Indicates that the request can not be processed as the client doesn't have a valid subscription. See [Handling expected errors](https://docs.nbold.co/api/best-practices.html#handling-expected-errors) article for more information.

403.description: Forbidden - Indicates that the server understood the request but refuses to authorize it. See [Handling expected errors](https://docs.nbold.co/api/best-practices.html#handling-expected-errors) article for more information.

404.description: Not Found - Indicates that the origin server did not find a current representation for the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists. See [Handling expected errors](https://docs.nbold.co/api/best-practices.html#handling-expected-errors) article for more information.

429.description: Too Many Requests - Your request has been throttled as you've reached the maximum number of concurrent calls to our service. Look at the "Retry-After" header. See [API throttling guidance](https://docs.nbold.co/api/throttling.html) article for more information.

500.description: Internal Server Error - Indicates that the server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request. See [Handling expected errors](https://docs.nbold.co/api/best-practices.html#handling-expected-errors) article for more information.

503.description: Service Unavailable - Indicates that the server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overload or scheduled maintenance, which will likely be alleviated after some delay. See [Handling expected errors](https://docs.nbold.co/api/best-practices.html#handling-expected-errors) article for more information.
